datasetId.title: Dataset ID
datasetId.description: Id of dataset where the data are located. If you need to use other input types like Key value store or raw JSON, look at `Other data sources`

checkOnlyCleanItems.title: Check only clean dataset items
checkOnlyCleanItems.description: Only clean dataset items will be loaded and use for duplications checking if `datasetId` option is provided.

field.title: Field
field.description: Field or list of fields in each item that will be checked for duplicates. Each given field must not be nested and it should contain only simple value (string or number). You can prepare your data with preCheckFunction.

preCheckFunction.title: Pre-check function
preCheckFunction.description: You can specify which fields should display in the debug OUTPUT to identify bad items. By default it shows all fields which may make it unnecessary big.
preCheckFunction.example: (data) => data.map((item) => ({ url: item.url, imageSrc: item.images && item.images[0] ? item.images[0].src : null }))

minDuplications.title: Minimum duplications
minDuplications.description: Minimum occurences to be included in the report. Defaults to 2

showIndexes.title: Show indexes
showIndexes.description: Indexes of the duplicate items will be shown in the OUTPUT report. Set to false if you don't need them.
showIndexes.groupDescription: Showing more will help you debug but uses more memory.

showItems.title: Show items
showItems.description: Duplicate items will be pushed to a dataset. Set to false if you don't need them.

showMissing.title: Show missing fields
showMissing.description: Items where the values for the `field` is missing or is `null` or `''` will be included in the report.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: How many items will be checked. Default is all
limit.sectionDescription: Allows you to pick parts of the dataset to check.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: From which item the checking will start. Use with limit to check specific items.

batchSize.title: Batch Size
batchSize.description: You can change number of loaded and processed items in each batch. This is only needed if you have really huge items.

keyValueStoreRecord.title: Key value store Record
keyValueStoreRecord.description: ID and record key if you want to load from KV store. Format is `{keyValueStoreId}+{recordKey}`, e.g. `s5NJ77qFv8b4osiGR+MY-KEY`
keyValueStoreRecord.sectionDescription: Allows you to load from Key value store or arbitrary JSON.

rawData.title: Raw Data
rawData.description: Raw JSON array you want to check.
